slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
Hi Everyone and welcome to Home Remodeling and Construction 101, the Six Steps for an on-time, on-budget, and hassle-free building project.

I’m Jim Wagner and I will be walking you through the entire process of managing any remodeling or construction project, whether it’s a simple room renovation , a gourmet kitchen, an addition to your existing house, or building a new home from the ground up.

It can seem like a complicated, even mind-boggling experience.

But we’ve developed a specific six-step process you can follow that brings it all down to Earth, a roadmap, that will lead to the home of your dreams.

At each step you’ll learn strategies that will save you time, money, a lot of headaches, even legal problems. We will show you how to stay in control of the entire process. You won’t find anything this comprehensive anywhere else.

We hope you enjoy this course and find it useful. Let’s get started.

Hi Everyone and welcome to Home Remodeling and Construction 101, the Six Steps for an on-time, on-budget, and hassle-free building project.

I’m Jim Wagner and I will be walking you through the entire process of managing any remodeling or construction project, whether it’s a simple room renovation , a gourmet kitchen, an addition to your existing house, or building a new home from the ground up.

It can seem like a complicated, even mind-boggling experience.

But we’ve developed a specific six-step process you can follow that brings it all down to Earth, a roadmap, that will lead to the home of your dreams.

At each step you’ll learn strategies that will save you time, money, a lot of headaches, even legal problems. We will show you how to stay in control of the entire process. You won’t find anything this comprehensive anywhere else.

We hope you enjoy this course and find it useful. Let’s get started.

The perfect home - it’s a dream and it’s within your reach, and that’s really exciting. But once the dreaming stops and the work begins, it can begin to look really complicated, even scary. Where do you start? How long will it take? How much will it cost? Who does what? And the ever-present “What If…?”

It can be like a freeway maze. There are side roads and detours. Wrong turns and dead ends. Speed traps and bad directions everywhere. You don’t know where to start. Pretty soon you feel like your project is driving you instead of you driving your project.

But there is a better way. There is light on the horizon. The six step process we teach you in this course unravels the maze. It keeps you in control and on track. You will stay on time and on budget. You will bypass the hazards. And most important, you will stay in the driver’s seat.

Lets take a look at the six steps and what they will teach you to do.

The first step is Know Your Limits. Here you will learn the three things you must do before starting any remodeling or construction project. You will know how to determine your property boundaries and when you need to call in a surveyor. You will learn the municipal zoning regulations that directly impact your property. And you’ll know the three types of insurance that your contractors and you need. Knowing your limits is the starting point for any project.

The second step is Design Your Dream. Here you will learn the five choices you have for designing your project and how to choose the best one for you. You will learn how to work with your designer to create plans that realize your dream and pass the complex design review process. You’ will find advice if you want to design it yourself. And you will learn money-saving tips for working with designers that you probably never thought of.

The third step is Get Your Permits. You will learn how to use the all-important building permit as a valuable tool in developing a schedule. You will learn what requires a permit and, just as important, what you can do without a permit. Knowing this can save you a lot of time and money. You will know what to expect when the inspectors arrive. And you will learn what to do if a contractor says he can get away without a permit when you know you need one.

Step Four is Hire the Best. This is one of the most important decisions you will make. You will learn the four things to look for in a builder, and the five things to avoid. You will find out if you need a general contractor at all. You will be able to identify and avoid the most common and costly mistakes people make when they hire a contractor. We will show you a repeatable process for handling bids and matching the right contractor to your job.

In Step Five, Write It Down, you will learn how to make rock-solid yet flexible agreements with the people you hire. We will cover the contract for design services, the agreement with your general contractor, how to reflect the schedule and costs in your agreements, and how to handle changes. You will learn the 27 things every builders contract must have. You will learn where to find low-cost and even free contract templates that you can easily adapt for your project. And you will be able to identify gaps in any standard agreements presented by your contractor or designer.

And finally in Step Six, Get Ready to Build, you will learn all about the health, safety, environmental, recycling, and public works regulations and permits that impact your project. You’ll know all the permits that are needed. If you are working with a general contractor, you will be able to monitor the job site and the costs to ensure everything is being covered and you are not paying too much.

The main point of this course is simple. You need to run your project. Your project should not run you. Putting these six steps into action will ensure that you control the conversation with your designer, builder, and local building officials. You will stay in the driver’s seat on the way to the home of your dreams.

As you make your way through the course, you will see these buttons come alive. Here’s what they do.

The dollar sign icon shows you specific ways you can substantially cut costs and save a lot of money and time.

The Tools icon has specific advice for owner-builders. If you decide to be your own designer and builder, these nuggets will tell you what you need to do and when.

The Light bulb icon provides a deeper dive into an important topic. You’ll find checklists, detailed explanations, links to websites, and more.

The Red Flag gives you strategies for avoiding mistakes that can cause serious financial or even legal trouble. Pay attention to red flags!

Finally, the Case Study icon shows a real-world example of a particular topic.

(New buttons – need to clearly differentiate between buttons and callouts. Need a new and completely consistent format for callouts too.)

(Consider showing a road with eight signs and a nice house at the end of the road on the horizon.)

So let’s get started! It’s OK to skip around in this course, but we recommend you go through each of the sections in order, starting with Know Your Limits and ending with Ready to Build. Just click a button to start.
